definition:
The [*opposite polynomial*]{} of a polynomial $P$ in a polynomial ring
$R[X]$ is a polynomial $-P$ such that $$P\!+\!(-P) \;=\; \textbf{0},$$
where $\textbf{0}$ denotes the zero polynomial. It is clear that $-P$ is
obtained by changing the signs of all of the coefficients of $P$,
$$-\sum_{\nu = 0}^n a_\nu X^\nu \;=\; \sum_{\nu = 0}^n (-a_\nu)X^\nu.$$

The opposite polynomial may be used to define subtraction of
polynomials: $$P\!-\!Q \;=:\; P\!+\!(-Q)$$

Forming the opposite polynomial is a linear mapping $R[X]\to R[X]$.
